text:
I found this problem while a servlet use sendRedirect( very long URL ).
The result was a not well formated HTTP-Header sending to the client.

I found something in the jk_ajp12_worker.c:
reason saves the position in line but line is a buffer, that will be reused by 
jk_sb_gets() - so the reason-pointer that is passed to start_response() points 
somewhere - nobody knows where 
My fix just define a static pointer to a buffer in which i copy the response 
value. This buffer will be rezized as needed - i hope this is a way you agree.

I will post the PATCH in the mailing list - not here ?!
creator: roloff@mecom.de
roloff@mecom.de
text:
Created attachment 260
Patchfile to tomcat 3.2.2 for jk_ajp12_worker.c

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
Instead of the proposed patch, which allocates its own memory, I simply used 
jk_pool_strdup() to create a copy of the reason string.

The changes have been committed to tomcat_32 and J-T-C.

creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
Marc's fix has been applied to Tomcat 3.3 and will appear in Release
Candidate 2.
